Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman hit a walk-off grand slam in the bottom of the 10th inning as the Los Angeles Dodgers outlasted the New York Yankees 6-3 in Game 1 of the 2024 World Series.
Jazz Chisholm manufactured a go-ahead run thanks to a single and a pair of stolen bases in the top of the 10th inning.
The Yankees jumped ahead in the top of the 10th inning when Jazz Chisholm scored on a fielder's choice by Anthony Volpe.
Pre-Game Insights: Analysts predicted a close game between the two rival teams.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts described the moment when he heard the walk-off grand slam off Freddie Freeman’s bat as ‘greatest baseball moment I've ever witnessed.'
Freddie Freeman talked about his walk-off grand slam in Game 1 of the World Series against the New York Yankees.
Aaron Judge discussed the Yankees' loss to the Dodgers in the bottom of the 10th inning of Game 1 of the World Series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the third straight year that Game 1 of the World Series went to extras.
The game went into 15 innings before a decisive home run by Mike Trout.
Others: The Dodgers ended a 20-year championship drought with their victory in Game 1 of the World Series.
